The number of homes being built in Britain has halved since the early 1970 s -- largely due to local government all but ceasing housebuilding activity , said Grainne Gilmore , head of British residential research at Knight Frank .
About 2,000 homes were completed by boroughs last year , a 99 per cent drop from the 185,000 built in 1970 , she said .
